texts.text-4-0: Every night the monkeys climb a tree to sleep in.
texts.text-4-1: They sleep on very long branches.
texts.text-4-2: There, no animal can get them.
texts.text-5-0:
One night a mother
                leopard came to the monkeys’ tree.
texts.text-6-1: She climbed it very, very quietly.
texts.text-7-4: She did not want to wake Momo up.
texts.text-8-0: She came near Momo but the branch shook.
texts.text-8-2: Momo woke up and saw the leopard in front of him.
texts.text-9-0: Momo shouted and pointed at the leopard.
texts.text-9-1: The monkeys woke up and shouted.
texts.text-9-2: They threw sticks at the mother leopard.
texts.text-9-3: She jumped to the ground and ran into the forest.
texts.text-10-0: Next night mother leopard came with baby leopard.
texts.text-10-2: but it could climb the trees.
texts.text-11-0: The baby leopard climbed the tree.
texts.text-12-0: Momo was sleeping on a very long branch.
texts.text-12-1: The baby leopard saw him and went very quietly onto the branch.
texts.text-13-0: The branch was very, very long.
texts.text-13-1: The baby leopard came near Momo but the branch shook.
texts.text-13-2: It shook and it shook and it woke Momo up.
texts.text-14-0: Momo jumped onto a bigger branch.
texts.text-14-1: The baby leopard jumped but he could not get Momo.
texts.text-17-2: The leopards ran into the forest.
texts.text-17-3: They did not have a monkey for dinner that night.
texts.text-19-1:
\\u201cAn education and enlightened society of GNH, built and sustained on the unique Bhutanese values of Tha
                Dam-Tsig Ley Gju-Drey.\\u201d

texts.sectioneli5-0-0: This story is called "Momo and the Leopards." It's for young children like you in Class 1. In the picture, you see Momo, who is like a little monkey, sleeping safely on a tree at night. There's a friendly leopard below and an owl watching. They're all together in the quiet night sky full of stars.
texts.sectioneli5-2-0: This is the title of a book for young kids. It's about Momo and some leopards. It seems like it might tell an exciting story about Momo meeting leopards and what happens next. Since it's for children, it might have fun pictures and easy words to help tell the story.
texts.sectioneli5-4-0: Monkeys, every night, climb up into the trees to go to sleep. They pick long, safe branches high up in the tree. This way, they're snug and can't be reached by other animals. It's like having their own cozy bed up high!
texts.sectioneli5-5-0: One night, a mother leopard walked over to where some monkeys were hanging out in a tree. This is kind of like when your pet or a friend's pet comes to visit you where you're playing. The monkeys are up in the tree, staying safe and cozy.
texts.sectioneli5-6-0: In this story, a mother leopard is very good at climbing trees. She does it super quietly, like sneaking around. Imagine if you were trying to climb something without anyone hearing you—that's what she was doing!
texts.sectioneli5-7-0: In this story, there's a little monkey named Momo sleeping on a tree branch at nighttime. Someone else climbs up very quietly because they don't want to wake Momo up. It's important to be gentle and quiet so Momo can keep dreaming peacefully.
texts.sectioneli5-8-0: Momo is a monkey sitting on a tree branch. Suddenly, the branch starts to shake a lot, waking him up. When he looks, he sees a big leopard right in front of him. It's a surprising moment for Momo!
texts.sectioneli5-9-0: Momo, a monkey, saw a leopard and shouted to warn his friends. The other monkeys woke up and made lots of noise. They threw sticks at the leopard to scare her away. The mother leopard got frightened and ran away into the forest. It’s like when something scary shows up and everyone works together to make it go away.
texts.sectioneli5-10-0: One night, there was a mommy leopard and her little baby leopard. The baby leopard was small, but it was good at climbing trees. It's like how you might be small, but you can do cool things too!
texts.sectioneli5-11-0: Once upon a time, a little baby leopard wanted to explore. So, it very quietly started to climb up a big tree. Up in the tree, some monkeys were fast asleep, dreaming away. The baby leopard was super sneaky, making sure not to wake them while it climbed.
texts.sectioneli5-12-0: Momo the monkey is having a snooze on a big, long tree branch. Along comes a baby leopard, who sees Momo and tries to carefully climb up to him without making any noise. It's like when you're playing hide and seek and you tiptoe to not wake your friend who's pretending to sleep!
texts.sectioneli5-13-0: In this story, there's a long tree branch where a baby leopard and a monkey named Momo are sitting. The baby leopard gets close to Momo, but then the branch starts to shake! It shakes a lot and wakes Momo up, who was probably asleep. It's like when you're lying on a swing and someone moves it—you wake up because of the shaking.
texts.sectioneli5-14-0: Momo the monkey was in the trees and jumped to a bigger branch to stay safe. The little leopard tried to jump and catch him, but he couldn't reach Momo. Momo was outsmarting the little leopard by moving higher in the tree.
texts.sectioneli5-15-0: The baby leopard was up in the tree, but then it slipped! It started falling down from the branch, just like when you slide down a slide. The picture shows it tumbling through the air with the night sky full of stars and the moon behind it.
texts.sectioneli5-16-0: Here we see a small leopard falling out of a tree and landing safely and softly on its mother's back. It's like a gentle landing onto a big, warm pillow, showing how a mommy leopard takes care of her baby, even when it's being playful and silly.
texts.sectioneli5-17-0: The monkeys woke up and saw leopards nearby. To keep safe, the monkeys yelled loudly and threw sticks at the leopards. This scared the leopards, and they ran away into the forest, so the monkeys weren't eaten for dinner!
texts.sectioneli5-19-0: The vision is about making a world where everyone learns a lot and is happy. This world is built using special values important to Bhutan. It's like saying we want everyone to know things and be joyful by following some special rules that help us all get along better.
texts.easyread-text-0-0: Momo and the leopards is about a character named Momo and some leopards.
texts.easyread-text-0-1: This is a book for first grade. It has easy words and pictures for kids.
texts.easyread-text-2-1: This is a book for kids in first grade, Book 11.
texts.easyread-text-4-0: Monkeys go up a tree to sleep every night.
texts.easyread-text-4-1: They sleep on long tree branches.
texts.easyread-text-4-2: The animals are safe there, and no other animals can reach them.
texts.easyread-text-5-0: One night, a leopard mom visited the monkeys' tree.
texts.easyread-text-6-0: A mother leopard went up the tree.
texts.easyread-text-7-0: She looked at a baby monkey.
texts.easyread-text-7-1: It was someone or something called Momo.
texts.easyread-text-7-2: She went up the tree and sat on the branch.
texts.easyread-text-7-4: She did not want to wake up Momo.
texts.easyread-text-8-0: She went close to Momo, but the branch moved.
texts.easyread-text-8-2: Momo opened his eyes and saw a leopard in front of him.
texts.easyread-text-9-0: Momo saw a leopard and pointed at it loudly.
texts.easyread-text-9-1: The monkeys woke up and yelled.
texts.easyread-text-9-2: Some people threw sticks at the mother leopard.
texts.easyread-text-9-3: She jumped down and ran into the trees.
texts.easyread-text-10-0: The leopard mom came at night with her baby leopard.
texts.easyread-text-11-0: The little leopard went up the tree.
texts.easyread-text-12-0: Momo is napping on a big branch.
texts.easyread-text-12-1: The baby leopard saw him and quietly climbed onto the branch.
texts.easyread-text-13-1: The baby leopard moved close to Momo, but the branch wobbled.
texts.easyread-text-14-0: Momo moved to a bigger branch.
texts.easyread-text-14-1: The baby leopard tried to jump and catch Momo, but he missed.
texts.easyread-text-16-0: When someone feels sad, we say they feel down.
texts.easyread-text-17-2: The leopards went into the forest.
texts.easyread-text-17-3: They did not eat a monkey for dinner that night.
texts.easyread-text-19-0: Vision means being able to see things or dreaming about what you want to do in the future.
texts.easyread-text-19-1: In Bhutan, people want to be smart and happy. They follow special Bhutanese values to stay happy.
